tag_list: technology, photo, dad, iphone, sonos, software-com, babytoupee, istorytime, santa-barbara-luxury-rentals
overview:
Graham is a jack of all trades, serial entrepreneur, start-up loving, business building dad.

Graham was part of the founding team of Sonos Inc (http://www.sonos.com) which designed and manufactures a next-generation multi-zone wireless digital home stereo. As one of the early members of Sonos, Graham was instrumental in all areas of the company development from Product Design, Software/Hardware Validation, Press, Sales and Corporate IT infrastructure. Prior to Sonos, Graham was part of the original team at Software.com, which developed the first high-end email infrastructure servers for telephone companies and ISPs. Graham helped grow Software.com from a private company thru its initial public offering on the NASDAQ in 1999, during which time he was involved in Product Development, Product Testing, Network Design, Implementation and Sales. Before Software.com, Graham worked at WaveFront Technologies which was one of the first industrial 3-D animation software development companies. He is the founder and owner of Santa Barbara Luxury Rentals, an upscale vacation rental management company located in Santa Barbara, California. Santa Barbara Luxury Rentals has been in business since 2003 and was one of the first boutique vacation rental management companies in the Santa Barbara area. Graham studied Molecular Biology and Bio-Chemistry at the University of Colorado at Boulder. Graham is an avid adventurer, music fan and environmentalist. He has just returned from his second multi-year ocean adventure exploring the south pacific, the Mediterranean and the Caribbean seas. Graham founded and invented the BabyToupee line of wigs for babies (http://www.babytoupee.com). Most recently he launched iStoryTime a line of narrated, illustrated kids books on the iPhone (http://www.istorytimeapp.com) He also sits on the Board of Directors of both Heal the Ocean (http://www.healtheocean.org) and The Santa Barbara Bowl Foundation (http://www.sbbowl.com).
